articles.title: Stock Market LIVE updates: Sensex at day's high, up 250 pts; RCF zooms 20%

articles.title: Switzerland makes second interest rate cut as major economies diverge
articles.description: The Swiss National Bank trimmed its key interest rate by 25 basis points to 1.25% in its second cut of the year.
articles.content:
A view of the headquarters of the Swiss National Bank (SNB), before a press conference in Zurich, Switzerland, March 21, 2024.

articles.title: NatWest swoops on retailer Sainsbury's banking business
articles.description: NatWest has struck a deal to acquire most of the banking business of Sainsbury's in a deal that would increase the British lender's assets by $3.2 billion.
articles.content: Customers use automated teller machines (ATM) at a Sainsbury's supermarket in London, UK, on Tuesday, Feb. 14, 2023. The Office for National Statistics are due to release the latest UK CPI Inflation data on Wednesday. Photographer: Jose Sarmento Mato... [2289 chars]

articles.title: Mahindra XUV700 diesel trims contribute 77% to the SUV's total sales in May 2024
articles.description: Mahindra XUV700 diesel variant outsold the petrol variants in May 2024, just like it did in May last year.
articles.content: Mahinda XUV700 is one of the true blue SUVs in India and is a leading revenue churner for the homegrown automobile giant. The chunky SUV claims to have sold a total of 5,008 units in May this year and diesel models contributed the lion's share in the... [2412 chars]

articles.title: SDA accused of ripping off Woolworths store workers by endorsing 3.75pc pay deal
articles.description: Store workers at supermarket giant Woolworths have voted in favour of a new pay and entitlements package, after a union campaign plagued by allegations of "misinformation" and "bad faith bargaining".
articles.content:
In short: Woolworths workers have voted in favour of a wage increase of 3.75 per cent — the same as the Fair Work Commission's annual award wage increase.
Woolworths workers have voted in favour of a wage increase of 3.75 per cent — the same as the F... [6346 chars]

articles.title: 2,883% returns in five years, but has this fertiliser stock made you any money?
articles.description: Based on the March shareholding pattern, the government continues to own a 90% stake in FACT, while another government entity, the National Investment Fund, owns a 8.56% stake in the company.
articles.content:
